page.title: 07WATER SUPPLY
page.content: On Brayton Barff,a small hill to the west of Selby,there is a storage reservoir owned by the Yorkshire Water Authority. The reservoir was built here because this is the highest point in the area and water will flow to the customers under the force of gravity so that no pumping is needed. The original reservoir was built in 1906 and held 800,000 gallons of water. The new one was built in 1968 and holds 5 million gallons. This is only enough for half a day's supply. When the reservoir overflows the excess water is supposed to flow into Selby Dam,a nearby stream,but it often floods the surrounding fields. The Y.W.A. are thinking about demolishing the old brick pumphouse as it has suffered from vandalism in recent years. The new electric pump is housed in a much smaller building.
